name: RabbitMQ Autocluster Plugin
tagline: A RabbitMQ plugin that clusters nodes automatically using Consul, etcd2, DNS, or natively in AWS
body:
The rabbitmq-autocluster plugin clusters RabbitMQ nodes automatically using a pre-configured service discovery mechanism.

[![Downloads](https://img.shields.io/github/downloads/aweber/rabbitmq-autocluster/latest/total.svg)](https://github.com/aweber/rabbitmq-autocluster/releases) [[![GitHub release](https://img.shields.io/github/aweber/rabbitmq-autocluster.svg?maxAge=2592000)]()](https://github.com/aweber/rabbitmq-autocluster/releases)

The currently supported service discovery backends are:

- [Amazon AWS EC2 Tags](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/Using_Tags.html)
- [Amazon AWS Autoscaling Group Membership](https://aws.amazon.com/autoscaling/)
- [Consul](http://consul.io)
- A-Record based [DNS Round-robins](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Round-robin_DNS)
- [etcd2](https://coreos.com/etcd/docs/latest/)

**Important** The rabbitmq-autocluster plugin requires Erlang R17.5 or higher. This may not correspond with the minimum Erlang version required by RabbitMQ.

# Installation

1. Place both ``autocluster-%%VSN%%.ez`` and the ``rabbitmq_aws-%%VSN%%.ez`` plugin files in the RabbitMQ plugins directory.
1. Run ``rabbitmq-plugins enable autocluster``.
1. Configure the plugin.

Alternatively, there is a pre-built [Docker Image](https://hub.docker.com/r/aweber/rabbitmq-autocluster/) available at on [DockerHub](https://hub.docker.com/r/aweber/rabbitmq-autocluster/) as ``aweber/rabbitmq-autocluster``.

**Note** As of version 0.5 the autocluster plugin does not have a default backend configured. See the [Project Wiki](https://github.com/aweber/rabbitmq-autocluster/wiki) for configuration details.

# Configuration

Configuration documentation can be found in the [Project Wiki](https://github.com/aweber/rabbitmq-autocluster/wiki). Check out the [Getting Started](https://github.com/aweber/rabbitmq-autocluster/wiki/General%20Settings) page to learn about the initial configuration.
